args:
Finlorda confesses all of his past deeds: He was
the one who suggested that Aurelius attempt to
create a new life in place of a son who died
from wyrmscale, and he also used a piece of
the Other's body to make the deed possible.
Yours is not a natural-born life.
You were created through a combination\nof faerie magic and a thing...inhuman.
Yesâ€”and the thing that became your body\nwas something from a great struggle\nin ages long since past...
You were created with a piece\nof the Other's flesh.
My brother is made from...the Other?
I swear it is the truth: The prince you know\nwas created by my father, Finlorda.
And your father, Aurelius, gave his\ncomplete assent to the procedure.
You lie! Our father would never hide such\na thing from everyone!
We can judge the truth of his words\nonce he has told all.
I realize this comes as something of a\nshock, so I will continue to explain until\nthe both of you are satisfied.
Wait a second. So he's actually made\nwith a piece of the Other?
Draw your weapon, sir! I shall not stand by\nand allow you to slander His Highness so!
Do you truly want to hear the rest of this\nfaerie's tale, {player_name}?
If you think it may prove too much for you,\nthere is no shame in taking our leave.
Avoiding a painful truth sometimes is the\nonly way to maintain one's sanity, so I bid\nyou think carefully before you respond.
I want to hear everything. Every last word.
Very well. If this is your wish, I will stay\nat your side as the truth is unspooled.
It all started when I received a missive\nfrom my dear Aurelius:
ï¼‚My newborn son has been afflicted with\nwyrmscale. His symptoms worsen by the\nday, and I fear he has little time left.ï¼‚
ï¼‚I seek the succor of the faeries' vast\nknowledge and magic, and depart now\nfor your land with my ailing son in tow.ï¼‚
Soon thereafter, Aurelius and his child\nwere secreted in my kingdom.
But alas, it was already too late;\nthe wyrmscale had spread across\nthe poor child's entire body.
The disease was beyond even my ability,\nand soon the piteous babe drew his last.\nBut Aurelius did not give in.
He wanted his son back.\nBy any means necessary.
To think that the Wise King himself\nwould be so shaken...
Yet as returning the dead from the abyss\nis a task of exceeding difficulty, I made a\ndifferent proposal to my old friend.

There was once a kind of magic researched
in the Faerie Kingdomâ€”a magic that was
abandoned as being too dangerous and
beyond the pale.

This did I propose to my friend:
We would create a new life with that
forbidden magic, a life identical to
the one which had been lost.
I can't even start to wrap my brain\naround that one.

Yet while it is not reviving the dead,
crafting a replacement is no mean matter.
One must first fashion a body to serve as
the vessel, then place a soul inside.
In truth, I had tried the process before.\nHowever, the end results were...poor.
Nonetheless, I took advantage of\nAurelius's request to attempt the\nfeat once more.
The key to creating a life is constructing a\nsuitable body in which to house the soul.

By using blood obtained from the baby
before its passing and adding a number
of raw materials, I could forge a body that
resembled the deceased original.
However, this copy would never grow;\nit would be a pale imitation alone,\nfor mana would not flow through it.
Naturally. This is not like healing magic,\nwhere we assist the circulation of mana\nand in so doing restore the flesh.
You speak of a body which has lost its\nmana entirely. Such a thing can never\nbe restored.
Normally, yes. So to resolve that problem,\nI used a bit of flesh in which mana still\nflowed despite having lost its soul.
With this, I succeeded in creating a body\nfilled with mana, and one that would grow\nlike any another.
But mana within the body ought to wither\naway when the soul is lost. The kind of\nflesh that might do otherwise would be...
By the Goddess! Could it be...?
All of which leads us back to the piece of\nnews you told us in the beginning:
That flesh came from the Other.
But I thought the body of the Other was\nsealed away by His Majesty Alberius.
When Alberius used the Blood Casket to\nseal away the Other, his flesh was rent\nand fell in pieces across the world.
However, his power had not been lost.\nNot then, and not even now,\nhundreds of years later.
Some time ago, I discovered a substance\nin the Faewood which was possessed of\nboth awesome power and terrible malice.
Having already collected a great deal\nof material for the sake of my magical\nresearch, I took it home with me.
Upon inspection, I discovered it to be\none of these fragments of the Other.
How could you have known for certain?

I had previously read about the
characteristics of the Other, and the
substance matched perfectlyâ€”as did
the properties of the mana it exuded.

So when Aurelius came to me for aid,
I sought to cleanse the substance of its
impurities and use it as the basis of a
new body for the fallen child.
I took the Other's flesh, formed a vessel,\nand migrated the infant's soul into it.\nThus was new life born.
And that life became a new seventh scion.\nYou, {player_name}.
But the prince is able to shapeshift!
Surely this is proof he carries the\ntrue bloodline of King Alberius!
I suspect the power of shapeshifting was\ninherited when he was created.
We used blood from the original as a\ncomponent of the new body, after all.
Though I confess, I have no explanation\nas to how it is possible for him to forge\nmultiple dragon pacts.
Perhaps it is due in some part to the\nOther? In any case, that piece of the\npuzzle remains a mystery for now.
Regardless, this is the truth of your birth.
How? How could you do such a thing?
How could you commit such a profane act?
Because I once had a dream, you see.\nA foolish one, yet mine all the same...
